quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Character and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, actor, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Where was Senator Barack Obama born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Honolulu, Hawaii

questions.question: What actress is not correctly matched with the character she portrayed?

options.text: Elizabeth Taylor - Maggie the Cat (Cat on a Hot Tin Roof)
Elizabeth Montgomery - Baby Jane Hudson (What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth Montgomery - Baby Jane Hudson (What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?)

questions.question: This celebrity, who once said, Big girls need big diamonds, wrote the 2002 book My Love Affair with Jewelry.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth Taylor

questions.question: This actor married Linda Cozlowski after co-starring with her in a 1986 comedy film and its 1988 sequel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Hogan

questions.question: Paul Newman won the Best Actor Academy Award for his portrayal of Fast Eddie Felson in the movie The Color of Money. Name the previous movie in which Newman played the same character.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hustler

questions.question: What was the birth name of Elizabeth Arden who built a cosmetics empire in the US?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Florence Nightingale Graham

questions.question: What multiple Grammy Award-winning singer co-founded the band Wings with Linda Eastman and Denny Laine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul McCartney

questions.question: Whose mother was Saint Elizabeth according to the New Testament?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John the Baptists

questions.question: Upon the death of her father King George VI in 1952, Elizabeth II ascended the thrones of seven countries. Which of the following is not one of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: India

questions.question: Elizabeth I of England, also known as the Virgin Queen, was the last monarch of this dynasty.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tudor

questions.question: In this Oscar-nominated movie, Elisabeth Shue stars as a prostitute who has a doomed love affair with a depressed alcoholic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leaving Las Vegas

questions.question: As head coach of this team, Paul Bear Bryant won six national championships and thirteen conference championships.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: University of Alabama football team

questions.question: Elizabeth Blackwell, born in 1821 in Bristol, England, holds this distinction.

options.text: She was the first woman to earn a medical degree in the United States.
She was the first woman to gain a medical qualification in Britain.
She was the first woman to run for US President.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She was the first woman to earn a medical degree in the United States.

questions.question: In 1956, this poet and writer received the Pulitzer Prize for her collection of poetry, North  South.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth Bishop

questions.question: What Victorian author is famous for writing the social novel North and South and the biography of fellow novelist Charlotte Brontë?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth Gaskell

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Barack Obama and Senate
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, people, smith. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the name of Senator Barack Obama’s 2004 book that became number one bestseller on the New York Times nonfiction list?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Audacity of Hope

questions.question: Senator Barack Obama was the only African-American Senator in the Senate in 2006.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which three colleges did Barack Obama attend as a student?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Occidental, Columbia, and Harvard

questions.question: To which country did Barack Obama’s family move when he was six?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Indonesia

questions.question: What job did Barack Obama start after finishing his education?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Civil rights lawyer in Chicago

questions.question: US Senator Barack Obama has won a Grammy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Whom did Barack Obama defeat to win his Senate seat in 2005?

options.text: Paul Simon and Richard Daily, Jr.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A. Keyes

questions.question: What is the name of Barack Obamas first book?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dreams from My Father

questions.question: In which subject did Senator Barack Obama get his B.A.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Political Science

questions.question: Susan Smith was convicted of killing her 2 sons by drowning them in her car in 1994.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This Atlanta area woman was charged with the beating death of her 5-month-old daughter. Can you name her?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carisa Ashe

questions.question: Where was Senator Barack Obamas father born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kenya

questions.question: When did Barack Obama’s term as Senator in the United States Senate begin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2005

questions.question: This Texas mom killed her 11-month-old daughter in 2004 by amputating the babys arms with a knife and then offered her to God.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dena Schlosser

questions.question: Diane Downs was convicted in 1984 for shooting which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Her 1 son and 2 daughters

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Author and Stories
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, people, presidents. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who is the author of The Caballeros Way, The Gift of the Magi, Memoirs of a Yellow Dog, Cherchez la Femme?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Sydney Porter

questions.question: Who wrote the short stories .007, How the Leopard Got Its Spots, Kidnapped, The Man Who Would Be King?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rudyard Kipling

questions.question: He served one term as President and two terms as Vice President.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Adams

questions.question: Who is the author of the following short stories: The Iliad of Sandy Bar, Tennessees Partner, The Outcasts of Poker Flats, High Water Mark?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bret Harte

questions.question: The Secret Sharer, The Return, Heart of Darkness, The Lagoon are short stories written by this Polish-born author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joseph Conrad

questions.question: An Occurrence at Owl Creek Bridge, The Psychological Shipwreck, Beyond the Wall, Haita the Shepherd are short stories by this writer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ambroise Bierce

questions.question: What US President served more than two terms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin D. Roosevelt

questions.question: Who is the author The Red-headed League, The Adventure of the Blue Carbunkle and The Adventure of the Speckled Band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

questions.question: Genene Jones was a pediatric nurse in Texas whose shift was commonly referred to as the Death Shift.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these US Presidents was assassinated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James A. Garfield

questions.question: The Penal Colony, Before the Law, The Next Village, A Country Doctor, On the Train are short stories written by this author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franz Kafka

questions.question: Notes From the Underground and The Thief are short stories by this writer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fyodor Dostoevsky

questions.question: The Redheadded Outfield, The Rube, False Colors were penned by this author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zane Grey

questions.question: This Texas mom, convicted in 1996 of killing her 2 young sons, claimed an intruder broke in and murdered them.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Darlie Routier

questions.question: Who penned The Open Boat, The Snake, Four Men in a Cave and The Veteran?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stephen Crane

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Us and President
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, catherine. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what movie do Kate Winslet and Leonardo DiCaprio star as a married couple living in a Connecticut suburb?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Revolutionary Road

questions.question: Who is the first US President to remain a lifelong bachelor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Buchanan

questions.question: Which of these was physically the heaviest US President weighing over 300 pounds?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Howard Taft

questions.question: The son of a US President, he later became US President himself and took part in formulating the Monroe Doctrine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Quincy Adams

questions.question: Who was the last US President to be born in the 18th century?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Buchanan

questions.question: In the 1990s, Kate Moss waif look and her depiction in a Calvin Cline advertising campaign drew criticism from what President of the US?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Clinton

questions.question: In this movie Cate Blanchett and Kate Beckinsale play the roles of acclaimed real-life actresses who were both involved with Leonardo DiCaprios character.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Aviator

questions.question: In 1901, he became the youngest person to enter office as President.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Theodore Roosevelt

questions.question: Actress Katie Holmes first achieved fame for her role as Joey Potter on this television teen drama.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dawsons Creek

questions.question: Henry VIIIs attempt to have the 24-year marriage with his first wife annulled led to Englands break with the Roman Catholic Church. Which Cathrine was his first wife?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Catherine of Aragon

questions.question: In this 2001 movie, directed by Barry Levinson, Kate Blanchet portrays Kate Wheeler, a housewife disappointed with her marriage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bandits

questions.question: This Founding Father and US President promoted the ideals of republicanism in the US and supported the separation of church and state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: Who was the first US President to die in office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Henry Harrison

questions.question: Kate Bushs debut single is named after and based on this novel by Emily Bronte.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wuthering Heights

questions.question: Which of these events is believed to have been instigated by Catherine de Medici, who was queen consort of King Henry II of France from 1547 to 1559?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Bartholomews Day massacre

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Biography and History
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, recluse, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Mao Zedong refused to brush his teeth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: According to a biography by Clark Gable she was extremely dirty, and not in the sexual sense.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marilyn Monroe

questions.question: What German composer, who was attracted to the ideals of the Enlightenment, refused to bathe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ludwig van Beethoven

questions.question: He believed that cleanliness was a bourgeoisie excess.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Karl Marx

questions.question: Which American politician is credited with writing the Declaration of Independence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: Frederick II of Prussia refused to bathe and stopped changing his clothes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: One of the richest women in history, she bathed just a few times and wore several black dresses her entire life.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henrietta Green

questions.question: This popular French king who tried to provide his citizens with a “chicken in the pot every Sunday” became known for his refusal to bathe and mask his odor with cologne after hunting.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry IV of France

questions.question: Which President of the United States wrote, Rules of Civility and Decent Behavior in Company and Conversation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Washington

questions.question: Gregor Mendel wrote On the Origins of Species in 1859.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who won an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for the portrayal of Velma Kelly, a vaudevillian who murdered her adulterous husband and her sister?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Catherine Zeta-Jones

questions.question: This celebrity became a recluse, who refused to bathe and trimmed his hair and nails only once a year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Howard Hughes

questions.question: Benedict of Aniane was a monk that spent most of his life in rags.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This king who ruled France for 72 years was probably hydrophobic and refused to bathe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis XIV

questions.question: Which scholastic tome was NOT written by Issac Newton?

options.text: Gravity and Physics: An In-depth Study
An Historical Account of Two Notable Corruptions of Scripture

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gravity and Physics: An In-depth Study

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Phrase and Golds
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, scrolls. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Tug McGraw played for the New York Mets from 1975-1984.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 1975 I defeated then popular player, Jimmy Conners, and went on to win the Wimbledon singles title. I retired in 1980 due to health problems with 818 wins and 51 titles. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arthur Ashe

questions.question: The phrase United we stand, divided we fall has been used in mottoes and songs. Who is this phrase attributed to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aesop

questions.question: The famed Dead Sea Scrolls which contain ancient scriptures from the Hebrew Bible were written by which ancient people?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Essenes

questions.question: Who is this expression attributed to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alcuin

questions.question: I won 10 Olympic medals including 9 golds, and 10 World Championships medals including 8 golds, during my career that spanned from 1979 to 1996. My events were the 100, 200, 4X100 relay and the long jump. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carl Lewis

questions.question: Whose autobiography was titled  An Autobiography or My Experiments with Truth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mohandas Ghandi

questions.question: I attended Indiana University and was drafted 2nd overall in the 1981 NBA draft by the Detroit Pistons.  Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Isiah Thomas

questions.question: What feminist activist made this statement?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robin Morgan

questions.question: Profiles in Courage is the book written by John F. Kennedy that won him the Pulitzer Prize for Biography in 1957.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: May you live all the days of your life is a quote by this famous person.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jonathan Swift

questions.question: Ancient Egyptians wrote on papyrus.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Jack Nicklaus is also known as The Golden Bear.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who is credited with the quote, Reserve your right to think, for even to think wrongly is better than not to think at all.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hypatia of Alexandria

questions.question: Letter from Birmingham Jail was written by Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. after he was jailed for eating at a segregated lunch counter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False
